intro: Calochortus montanus, commonly known as the Sierra mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy, often showy, and sometimes fragrant blooms. This particular species is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and woodland habitats. Calochortus montanus is an important plant in its native ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
